org.jcvlib.imageproc

Class ImageMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvlib.imageproc.ImageMath

  • public class ImageMath
extends java.lang.Object
    Contain methods to perform arithmetic operation with images, like sum, subtraction and multiplication and etc.
    Version:
    1.012
    Author:
    Dmitriy Zavodnikov (d.zavodnikov@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static Image sum(Image image1,
        Image image2)
        This method sum 2 given images.

        If value of color more than Color.COLOR_MAX_VALUE this color value set Color.COLOR_MAX_VALUE.

      • absDiff

        public static Image absDiff(Image image1,
            Image image2)
        Absolute value of difference between 2 images.

      • mult

        public static Image mult(Image image,
         double c)
        This method multiply image on number.

        If value of color more than 255.0 this color value set 255.0.

      • getMean

        public static Color getMean(Image image)
        Return arithmetic mean of colors in current image.

      • convolve

        public static double[] convolve(Image image,
                Jama.Matrix kernel)
        Calculate matrix convolution.
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernel - Matrix for convolution.
        Returns:
        Array with result of convolution matrix to all channels of image.

      • injectImage

        public static Image injectImage(Image baseImage,
                Point injectPosition,
                Image injectImage)
        Put one image to another (using Alpha channel).

        The images must have the same channels size. The last channel uses as Alpha channel.

        Parameters:
        baseImage - This image will be changed. This image should have 3 or 4 channels!
        injectPosition - Position where will be injected injectImage on baseImage.
        injectImage - This image injected to baseImage image. This image should have 3 or 4 channels!
        Returns:
        Image with combination of baseImage and injectImage. That image have same size and type as baseImage and have 3 channels.
